availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: A. G. Roberts (Pendleton County, KY, attorney, notary, & captain 5th KY Inf CSA)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney, notary public, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Louisa Roberts. Father of Catherine M. Roberts, Ann R. Roberts, Ellen Roberts, Louisa F. Roberts, William A. Roberts, and Virginia C. Roberts. Attorney in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Infantry Brigade (C.S.A.) as a captain. Notary public in Pendleton County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 7.
Memorial History of Louisville from Its First Settlement to the year 1896, Josiah Stoddard Johnston, ed., vol. 1 (Chicago: American Biographical Publishing Co., 1896), 209.
KYR-0001-020-1462.
